an6.47:1: Then the wanderer Moliyasīvaka approached the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him.[n.347] Moliyasīvaka is also at SN36:2, IV 230–3, where he inquires from the Buddha whether all feeling is due to past kamma.When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side and said to the Blessed One:
an6.47:2: "Well then, Sīvaka, I will question you in turn about this. Answer as you see fit. What do you think, Sīvaka? (1) When there is greed within you, do you know: ‘There is greed within me,’ and when there is no greed within you, do you know: ‘There is no greed within me’?"
an6.47:3: "What do you think, Sīvaka? (2) When there is hatred within you … () … delusion within you … (4) … a state connected with greed within you[n.149]Lobhadhammā. Similarly, just below, the text hasdosadhammāandmohadhammā.Mpglosses as "the factors associated with it"(taṁsampayuttadhammā).… (5) … a state connected with hatred within you … (6) … a state connected with delusion within you, do you know: ‘There is a state connected with delusion within me,’ and when there is no state connected with delusion within you, do you know: ‘There is no state connected with delusion within me’?"
an6.47:4: "Excellent, Bhante! … Let the Blessed One consider me a lay follower who from today has gone for refuge for life."
